title: Small Vineyard Imports Tasting
description:
Join us on Wednesday, September 17, from 4–7 PM at Whispering Vine South Creek for a tasting that showcases unique selections from Italy’s small, family-run producers. This lineup offers both classic regional styles and fresh new expressions from lesser-known vineyards.

Tasting Fee: $25 (Buy a bottle from the tasting and your fee is refunded)

Featured Wines:

• Martoccia Brunello di Montalcino 2017 – Wild berry, tobacco, and cherry with polished tannins and smoky nuance.

• La Quercia Montepulciano Riserva 2021 – Bold and ripe with dark plum, cherry, earth spice, and sweet tannins.

• Clavesana Dogliani DOCG 2023 – Juicy and lively Dolcetto with cherry, blackberry, violet, and almond notes.

• Cala Civetta Sangiovese Toscana 2024 – Bright, approachable Sangiovese with red cherry, plum, and fresh acidity.

Celebrate the diversity of Italy’s small vineyard wines—buy a bottle and your tasting is free.
